doc:
Trevor Adams https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Trevor_Adams 0 Trevor Michael Adams (19 May 1946 – 15 December 2000) was a British actor, best remembered for his portrayal of Tony Webster in the BBC series The Fall and Rise of Reginald Perrin (1976–79), whom he played throughout its entire run, and Alan in "The Wedding Party" (1975), an episode of Fawlty Towers. Adams attended the then Harold Hill Grammar School, in Harold Hill, Essex from 1957 to 1964, and played leading roles in a number of school plays. Later he trained at RADA and was a member of the National Youth Theatre. He spent a year at Stratford-Upon-Avon before turning to television, where he was often cast as a criminal. He had roles in the films Groupie Girl (1970) and Private Road (1971), and appeared in a variety of programmes in Britain, notably Fawlty Towers, Public Eye, The Professionals, Z-Cars, The New Avengers and Dixon of Dock Green. He left the acting profession in 1982, before moving to Norwich. He did not appear in the 1996 follow-up to The Fall and Rise of Reginald Perrin, entitled The Legacy of Reginald Perrin, as he could not be traced by the producers. Trevor Adams died in 2000 after a lengthy battle with cancer. Trevor_Michael_Adams ( 19_May_1946 – 15_December_2000 ) was a_British_actor , best remembered for his_portrayal of Tony_Webster in the_BBC_series The_Fall_and_Rise of Reginald_Perrin ( 1976 – 79 ) , whom he played throughout its_entire_run , and Alan in " The_Wedding_Party " ( 1975 ) , an_episode of Fawlty_Towers . Adams attended the_then_Harold_Hill_Grammar_School , in Harold_Hill , Essex from 1957 to 1964 , and played_leading roles in a_number of school_plays . Later he trained at RADA and was a_member of the_National_Youth_Theatre . He spent a_year at Stratford-Upon-Avon before turning to television , where he was_often_cast as a_criminal . He had roles in the_films_Groupie_Girl_(_1970_)_and_Private_Road ( 1971_) , and appeared in a_variety of programmes in Britain , notably Fawlty_Towers , Public_Eye , The_Professionals , Z-Cars , The_New_Avengers_and_Dixon of Dock_Green . He left the_acting_profession in 1982 , before moving to Norwich . He did_not_appear in the_1996_follow-up to The_Fall_and_Rise of Reginald_Perrin , entitled The_Legacy of Reginald_Perrin , as he could_not_be_traced by the_producers . Trevor_Adams died in 2000 after a_lengthy_battle with cancer .
